TopicTitle: Don't blacklist parts with category=none when filtering by tag

Articles.Content:
The filter by tag function in the editors ignore parts that have the category field set to none. This is understandable, as that category is used to hide parts.

However there are scenarios when a part category is set to none and it is still desiderable for it to be searched by tag. Namely, when creating custom part list icons in-code the only way to avoid showing a part both under the custom icon as well as the stock one is to set group to none. At that point you lose the search by tag.

So essentially you have to choose between avoiding duplicated parts in different categories, OR having the parts searchable by tag.

My suggestion is then as follow: blacklist the parts that aren't included in any current part list icons, instead of the ones that have category none.
This will remove the assumption that a part with category none is also hidden, as that may not be the case with partlist icons created in-code.

Hit this one already with FE and agree that filtering anything based on Category.none now that the floor has been opened for mods is just a bad idea

Is this possible using FilterExtension?  e.g. My parts generally have a unique manufacturer name.  Is there some way to block parts with a particular manufacturer name from showing up in a subcategory?

The closest solution I've found is to use the "Squad" category created by your plugin instead of the "Filter by Function" list like I'm used to.

Note the KAS EVA items suffer this same problem.
